body:
As the title states. I'm trying to find the proper branch to follow, and to start I figured I would start with the churches my ancestors attended.

That leaves me with Catholic or Presbyterian church. It's not hard to find information about Catholics, but Presbyterians are a foreign word to an unbaptized heretic such as myself. 

What can you tell me about Presbyterians? Are they based or cringe? How do their beliefs differ from modern Catholicism nowadays?
body_html:
As the title states. I'm trying to find the proper branch to follow, and to start I figured I would start with the churches my ancestors attended.

That leaves me with Catholic or Presbyterian church. It's not hard to find information about Catholics, but Presbyterians are a foreign word to an unbaptized heretic such as myself.

What can you tell me about Presbyterians? Are they based or cringe? How do their beliefs differ from modern Catholicism nowadays?
title: Thoughts on Presbyterians?

body:
>trying to find the proper branch to follow

Baptist. Find an independent fundamentalist Baptist church that uses a hymnal and the King James bible. Keep looking if they somehow have a woman or LGBTQEIEIO preacher.
body_html:
trying to find the proper branch to follow

Baptist. Find an independent fundamentalist Baptist church that uses a hymnal and the King James bible. Keep looking if they somehow have a woman or LGBTQEIEIO preacher.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body: They used to be ultra strict and old-fashioned and fundamentalist, but from what I hear they're way more relaxed now. I believe they're the ones who are called the "frozen chosen" for believing in double predestination, but I don't know any more details.

body: IFB churches are spawn of Satan and might as well reveal their real name, Pharisees. All they do is talk about being better than thou and delight in how everyone who isn't exactly like them is going to spend eternity burning and boiling in fire and brimstone. All they do is judge people, point fingers, control people, and make up all kinds of ridiculous fake rules that are impossible to follow, more to point fingers at others who break them than to actually follow them themselves. And don't even get me started on the whole "King James 1611" deception.

body:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presbyterianism#/media/File:Burning-Bush-1.gif  
>The burning bush is a common symbol used by Presbyterian churches; here as used by the Presbyterian Church in Ireland.[1] The Latin inscription underneath translates as "burning but flourishing".
body_html:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presbyterianism#/media/File:Burning-Bush-1.gif

The burning bush is a common symbol used by Presbyterian churches; here as used by the Presbyterian Church in Ireland.[1] The Latin inscription underneath translates as "burning but flourishing".

He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

parent.body:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presbyterianism#/media/File:Burning-Bush-1.gif  
>The burning bush is a common symbol used by Presbyterian churches; here as used by the Presbyterian Church in Ireland.[1] The Latin inscription underneath translates as "burning but flourishing".
parent.body_html:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presbyterianism#/media/File:Burning-Bush-1.gif

The burning bush is a common symbol used by Presbyterian churches; here as used by the Presbyterian Church in Ireland.[1] The Latin inscription underneath translates as "burning but flourishing".

body: Your first remark was "Keep looking if they somehow have a woman or LGBTQEIEIO preacher". I run far away from any "church" that cares exclusively about that crap, and that's the typical IFB attitude as you demonstrated so elegantly already. Not only because that's exactly the attitude of the Pharisees and self-righteousness and judging others rather than yourself is strictly condemned, especially towards outsiders and/or for selfish gain, but also because 90% of the time the excessive focus on these issues is founded on a fetish for a submissive 1950s housewife who wears dresses and is skin and bones. This typically includes sex scandals and rape rings of religious leaders who molest women including young girls, and they can get away with it because the congregation is duped into believing everything their ~~false god~~ pastor says. It's not a coincidence that these things always happen in exactly the places obsessed with sexual topics and "keeping women in their place". And if Jesus came to an IFB church I guarantee you they'd have him condemned to hell and run out of there so fast that he wouldn't even have a chance to sit down.

body:
What do you think Jesus would say if you went up to him boasting about how holy you are and how glad you're not like the rest of those worldly sinners (everyone is guilty of this but you are proud)? What do you think he would have to say about your molestation rings? What would he do when he found church members manipulating people and exhorting them for money? How about when he saw you care more about politics than him? If you think boasting about your piety and judging others every chance you get is the way to go then it's clear you've never even read part of a gospel, or your interpretation is so twisted by false teachers to be unrecognizable. "All things are lawful for me" is not a free pass to do whatever you want if you have a sincere heart, especially when you judge another while you yourself do the same things. If you judge yourself, then you will not be judged; if you judge another instead, you will be judged the same way. I say this to show you your error, and not to pass judgement on you, lest I be judged myself.

And as far as your favorite issues go, if you saw what Jesus advocated for you'd probably consider him despicable. Love thy neighbor, love your enemies, women aren't just pieces of meat made for sexual pleasure, celibacy, spiritual family replacing the nuclear family, lack of politics, rejection of earthly authorities and religious institutionalism (does not mean rebellion), preaching to evildoers, likely acceptance of castration, woman deacons and apostles, opposition to legalism, all things likely to trigger IFB fragilities.
body_html:
What do you think Jesus would say if you went up to him boasting about how holy you are and how glad you're not like the rest of those worldly sinners (everyone is guilty of this but you are proud)? What do you think he would have to say about your molestation rings? What would he do when he found church members manipulating people and exhorting them for money? How about when he saw you care more about politics than him? If you think boasting about your piety and judging others every chance you get is the way to go then it's clear you've never even read part of a gospel, or your interpretation is so twisted by false teachers to be unrecognizable. "All things are lawful for me" is not a free pass to do whatever you want if you have a sincere heart, especially when you judge another while you yourself do the same things. If you judge yourself, then you will not be judged; if you judge another instead, you will be judged the same way. I say this to show you your error, and not to pass judgement on you, lest I be judged myself.

And as far as your favorite issues go, if you saw what Jesus advocated for you'd probably consider him despicable. Love thy neighbor, love your enemies, women aren't just pieces of meat made for sexual pleasure, celibacy, spiritual family replacing the nuclear family, lack of politics, rejection of earthly authorities and religious institutionalism (does not mean rebellion), preaching to evildoers, likely acceptance of castration, woman deacons and apostles, opposition to legalism, all things likely to trigger IFB fragilities.
